alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Mellette; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:09AM MST until February 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory through this afternoon, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to around one inch with wind chills as low as 35 below zero. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory tonight and Wednesday morning, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Bennett County, Mellette County, Todd County and Tripp County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. A wind chill advisory means the combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
